_header: A mery tale y telle yow may
Note: Formerly 2165. For the Cursor Mundi ‘Assumption’, which is directly based on this text, but lacks the Prologue, see 6363; for other versions see 549, 1767, 3523, 4190, 4703.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, assumption of; legends, of Jesus and Mary
_description: The Assumption of Our Lady (earliest version) — in couplets, with a Prologue of ten lines

CULDd11.First Lines:
Of seynt marie þe swete maya meri tale tellen I
                    may…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…In to heuene þer he is king& ȝeue vs alle good
                    ending

CULFf238.First Lines:
A louely tale y yow tell mayOf seyne mary that swete mayThe be
                    bynnyng of þys lessonYs of hur Assumpcyon…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…To haue þat blys þere he ys kyngAnd gyf vs all
                    goode endynge
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.

CULGg4272.First Lines:
Merie tale telle ihc þis dayOf seinte Marye þat swete
                    may…
CULGg4272.Last Lines:
…Marie ansuerde wiþ milde steu[en]A[ ]sende me al while
                    of ful in [ ]…
CULGg4272.Facsimiles:
Parkes,  Malcolm B.,  and  Richard Beadle.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Poetical Works. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Cambridge University
                Library MS Gg.4.27. 3 vols Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1979 (vol. 1); 1980 (vols. 2-3).

BLAdd10036.First Lines:
In honorance of Ihesus CrystSitteþ stille & haueþ
                    lyft…
BLAdd10036.Last Lines:
…And an Aue marie þer toThat Ihesus graunt so.
                    Amen
BLAdd10036.Note: The usual Prologue replaced by another of 12 lines.

BLHar2382.First Lines:
A mery tale y telle yow mayof seynt Marie that swete
                    may…
BLHar2382.Last Lines:
…that we may to hene wendethat is withoute begynnyng &
                    ende
BLHar2382.Attributed Title:
De assumpcione sancte Marie (original textura heading in top margin
                    f. 75); Explicit sextus liber sancte Marie (as if continuation of 4080, original in large script
                    below last line of text, f. 86)

UnivLonSLV17.First Lines:
…Þer to ne letteþ hem haue no myȝtffor
                    sikerlyche hit were vnryȝt…
UnivLonSLV17.Last Lines:
…Þat he haþ vs here I seydeffor hit was in þe
                    tumbe y leyde…

Chetham8009.First Lines:
A merye tale tell I mayOf seint marye that swete mayAll this
                    tale and this lessonIs of here holy Assumpcion…
Chetham8009.Last Lines:
…That we may to the blysse wendThat lastithe evire with owte
                    end
